```{r Unreplicated 2k Split Plot Design Model 1}

library(daewr)

sol <- lm(y ~ A*B*C*D*E, data = plasma)
effects <- coef(sol)
effects <- effects[c(2:32)]
Wpeffects <- effects[c(1:4, 6:11, 16:19, 26)]
Speffects <- effects[c(5,12:15,20:25,27:31)]
summary(sol)

```

```{r Unreplicated 2k Split Plot Design Model 2}

# Load the necessary libraries
library(daewr)
library(lme4)

# Assuming your dataset is named 'plasma' and has columns A, B, C, D, E, and y
# Create a unique identifier for each run
plasma$Run <- as.factor (rep(1:16, each = 2))  # 16 reactor runs, each with 2 samples

# Fit the linear mixed-effects model
rmod <- lmer(y~(A+B+C+D+E)^2+ (1 | Run), data = plasma)

# Display the summary of the model
summary(rmod)

# Perform ANOVA on the model
anova(rmod)

# Extract the fixed effects
fixed_effects <- fixef(rmod)

# Categorize the fixed effects into Wpeffects and Speffects
effects <- fixed_effects[-1]  # Exclude the intercept
Wpeffects <- effects[c(1:4, 6:11, 16:19, 26)]
Speffects <- effects[c(5, 12:15, 20:25, 27:31)]

# Print the categorized effects
print(Wpeffects)
print(Speffects)

```

```{r USausage}

library(daewr)

# fo <- "ys ~ A + B + A:B +(1|Block) + (1|A:B:Block)+

rmod2 <- lmer(ys ~ A + B + A:B +(1|Block) + (1|A:B:Block)+
+ C + D + C:D + A:C + A:D + B:C + B:D + A:B:C + A:B:D +
+ A:C:D + B:C:D + A:B:C:D , data = sausage)

summary(rmod2)
anova(rmod2)
```
